Basics.description: Master the fundamental skill of seamlessly transitioning between tracks using volume and EQ controls.
Basics.tip: Start with tracks in similar BPM ranges for smoother transitions.

Beatmatching.description: Learn to synchronize the tempo and beats of two tracks for perfect transitions.
Beatmatching.tip: Practice identifying the first beat of each bar to align tracks correctly.

Build-Up/Breakdown.description: Create dynamic energy shifts by layering build-ups and breakdowns from multiple tracks.
Build-Up/Breakdown.tip: Use EQ to emphasize different elements during transitions.

Drops.description: Drop two tracks simultaneously or switch between drops of different tracks.
Drops.tip: Use harmonically compatible tracks and practice quick swaps for the best effect.

EQ.description: Control different frequency ranges to blend tracks professionally.
EQ.tip: Start by swapping similar frequencies between tracks.

Filter Transition.description: Use high-pass and low-pass filters for creative mixing effects.
Filter Transition.tip: Combine filter sweeps with EQ adjustments for smoother transitions.

FX.description: Use effects to change energy, create tension, and smooth out transitions.
FX.tip: Time your echo outs with the phrase length of the incoming track.

Key.description: Mix tracks that are in compatible musical keys for seamless blends.
Key.tip: Use the Camelot Wheel to find harmonically compatible tracks.

Loops.description: Create perfect loops to extend sections or create unique transitions.
Loops.tip: Practice setting loop points on phrase boundaries.

Stems.tip: Combine elements from different tracks to create live mashups.

Scratching.description: What is a DJ if he can't scratch?
Scratching.tip: Start at slower tempos and build up hand speed and coordination as you progress.
